tags.name: math
tags.description: The `<math>` MathML element is the top-level MathML element, used to write a single mathematical formula. It can be placed in HTML content where flow content is permitted.

attributes.name: display
attributes.description: Specifies the rendering mode. The values `block` and `inline` are allowed.

attributes.name: xmlns
attributes.description: Specifies the URI for the MathML namespace.

tags.name: merror
tags.description: The `<merror>` MathML element is used to display contents as error messages. The intent of this element is to provide a standard way for programs that generate MathML from other input to report syntax errors.

tags.name: mfrac
tags.description: The `<mfrac>` MathML element is used to display fractions. It can also be used to mark up fraction-like objects such as binomial coefficients and Legendre symbols.

attributes.name: linethickness
attributes.description: A `<length-percentage>` indicating the thickness of the horizontal fraction line.

tags.name: mi
tags.description: The `<mi>` MathML element indicates that the content should be rendered as an identifier such as function names, variables or symbolic constants. You can also have arbitrary text in it to mark up terms.

tags.name: mmultiscripts
tags.description: The `<mmultiscripts>` MathML element is used to attach an arbitrary number of subscripts and superscripts to an expression at once, generalizing the `<msubsup> element`. Scripts can be either prescripts (placed before the expression) or postscripts (placed after it).

tags.name: mn
tags.description: The `<mn>` MathML element represents a numeric literal which is normally a sequence of digits with a possible separator (a dot or a comma). However, it is also allowed to have arbitrary text in it which is actually a numeric quantity, for example "eleven".

tags.name: mo
tags.description: The `<mo>` MathML element represents an operator in a broad sense. Besides operators in strict mathematical meaning, this element also includes "operators" like parentheses, separators like comma and semicolon, or "absolute value" bars.

attributes.name: fence
attributes.description: A `<boolean>` indicating whether the operator is a fence (such as parentheses). There is no visual effect for this attribute.

attributes.name: largeop
attributes.description: A `<boolean>` indicating whether the operator should be drawn bigger when math-style is set to normal.

attributes.name: lspace
attributes.description: A `<length-percentage>` indicating the amount of space before the operator.

attributes.name: maxsize
attributes.description: A `<length-percentage>` indicating the maximum size of the operator when it is stretchy.

attributes.name: minsize
attributes.description: A `<length-percentage>` indicating the minimum size of the operator when it is stretchy.

attributes.name: movablelimits
attributes.description: A `<boolean>` indicating whether attached under- and overscripts move to sub- and superscript positions when math-style is set to compact.

attributes.name: rspace
attributes.description: A `<length-percentage>` indicating the amount of space after the operator.

attributes.name: separator
attributes.description: A `<boolean>` indicating whether the operator is a separator (such as commas). There is no visual effect for this attribute.

attributes.name: stretchy
attributes.description: A `<boolean>` indicating whether the operator stretches to the size of the adjacent element.

attributes.name: symmetric
attributes.description: A `<boolean>` indicating whether a stretchy operator should be vertically symmetric around the imaginary math axis (centered fraction line).

tags.name: mover
tags.description: The `<mover>` MathML element represents an operator in a broad sense. Besides operators in strict mathematical meaning, this element also includes "operators" like parentheses, separators like comma and semicolon, or "absolute value" bars.

attributes.name: accent
attributes.description: A `<boolean>` indicating whether the over script should be treated as an accent (i.e. drawn bigger and closer to the base expression).

tags.name: mpadded
tags.description: The `<mpadded>` MathML element is used to add extra padding and to set the general adjustment of position and size of enclosed contents.

attributes.name: depth
attributes.description: A `<length-percentage>` indicating the desired depth (below the baseline) of the element.

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: A `<length-percentage>` indicating the desired height (above the baseline) of the element.

attributes.name: lspace
attributes.description: A `<length-percentage>` indicating the horizontal location of the positioning point of the child content with respect to the positioning point of the element.

attributes.name: voffset
attributes.description: A `<length-percentage>` indicating the vertical location of the positioning point of the child content with respect to the positioning point of the element.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: A `<length-percentage>` indicating the desired depth (below the baseline) of the element.

tags.name: mphantom
tags.description: The `<mphantom>` MathML element is rendered invisibly, but dimensions (such as height, width, and baseline position) are still kept.

tags.name: mmultiscripts
tags.description: The `<mmultiscripts>` MathML element is used to attach an arbitrary number of subscripts and superscripts to an expression at once, generalizing the `<msubsup>` element. Scripts can be either prescripts (placed before the expression) or postscripts (placed after it).

tags.name: mroot
tags.description: The `<mroot>` MathML element is used to display roots with an explicit index.

tags.name: mrow
tags.description: The `<mrow>` MathML element is used to group sub-expressions, which usually contain one or more operators with their respective operands. This element renders as a horizontal row containing its arguments.

tags.name: ms
tags.description: The `<ms>` MathML element represents a string literal meant to be interpreted by programming languages and computer algebra systems.

attributes.name: lquote
attributes.description: The opening quote to enclose the content.

attributes.name: rquote
attributes.description: The closing quote to enclose the content.

tags.name: semantics
tags.description: The `<semantics>` MathML element associates annotations with a MathML expression, for example its text source as a lightweight markup language or mathematical meaning expressed in a special XML dialect.

attributes.name: encoding
attributes.description: The encoding of the semantic information in the annotation.

tags.name: mspace
tags.description: The `<mspace>` MathML element is used to display a blank space, whose size is set by its attributes.

attributes.name: depth
attributes.description: A `<length-percentage>` indicating the desired depth (below the baseline) of the element.

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: A `<length-percentage>` indicating the desired height (above the baseline) of the element.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: A `<length-percentage>` indicating the desired depth (below the baseline) of the element.

tags.name: msqrt
tags.description: The `<msqrt>` MathML element is used to display square roots (no index is displayed). The square root accepts only one argument, which leads to the following syntax: `<msqrt> base </msqrt>`.

tags.name: mstyle
tags.description: The `<mstyle>` MathML element is used to change the style of its children.

tags.name: msub
tags.description: The `<msub>` MathML element is used to attach a subscript to an expression.

tags.name: msubsup
tags.description:
The `<msubsup>` MathML element is used to attach both a subscript and a superscript, together, to an expression. 

It uses the following syntax: `<msubsup> base subscript superscript </msubsup>`.

tags.name: mtable
tags.description: The `<mtable>` MathML element allows you to create tables or matrices. Its children are `<mtr>` elements (representing rows), each of them having `<mtd>` elements as its children (representing cells). These elements are similar to `<table>`, `<tr>` and `<td>` elements of HTML.

tags.name: mtd
tags.description: The `<mtd>` MathML element represents a cell in a table or a matrix. It may only appear in a `<mtr>` element. This element is similar to the `<td>` element of HTML.

attributes.name: columnspan
attributes.description: A non-negative integer value that indicates on how many columns does the cell extend.

attributes.name: rowspan
attributes.description: A non-negative integer value that indicates on how many rows does the cell extend.

tags.name: mtext
tags.description:
The `<mtext>` MathML element is used to render arbitrary text with no notational meaning, such as comments or annotations. 
To display text with notational meaning, use `<mi>`, `<mn>`, `<mo>` or `<ms>` instead.

tags.name: mtr
tags.description: The `<mtr>` MathML element represents a row in a table or a matrix. It may only appear in a `<mtable>` element and its children are `<mtd>` elements representing cells. This element is similar to the `<tr>` element of HTML.

tags.name: munder
tags.description: The `<munder>` MathML element is used to attach an accent or a limit under an expression. It uses the following syntax: `<munder> base underscript </munder>`

attributes.name: accentunder
attributes.description: A `<boolean>` indicating whether the under script should be treated as an accent (i.e. drawn bigger and closer to the base expression).

tags.name: munderover
tags.description: The `<munderover>` MathML element is used to attach accents or limits both under and over an expression.

attributes.name: accent
attributes.description: A `<boolean>` indicating whether the over script should be treated as an accent (i.e. drawn bigger and closer to the base expression).

attributes.name: accentunder
attributes.description: A `<boolean>` indicating whether the under script should be treated as an accent (i.e. drawn bigger and closer to the base expression).

globalAttributes.name: dir
globalAttributes.description: The text direction. Possible values are either `ltr` (left to right) or `rtl` (right to left).

globalAttributes.name: displaystyle
globalAttributes.description: A `<boolean>` specifying whether to set the math-style to `normal` (if true) or `compact` (otherwise).

globalAttributes.name: href
globalAttributes.description: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

globalAttributes.name: id
globalAttributes.description: Sets up a unique identifier associated with the element.

globalAttributes.name: mathsize
globalAttributes.description: A `<length-percentage>` used as a font-size for the element.

globalAttributes.name: mathvariant
globalAttributes.description: The logical class of token elements, which varies in typography.

globalAttributes.name: scriptlevel
globalAttributes.description: Specifies a math-depth for the element. See the scriptlevel page for accepted values and mapping.
